VPR.A: The heatmap shows a {radial gradient} pattern.

EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.93}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Attractions and Budget or the cell corresponding to Events and Cultural?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Events} and {Cultural} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Destinations and Adventure or the cell corresponding to Cruises and Cultural?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Cruises} and {Cultural} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Events and Luxury or the cell corresponding to Service Quality and Urban?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Service Quality} and {Urban} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.49 to 0.62?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Transport, Family), (Restaurants, Luxury), (Service Quality, Luxury), (Attractions, Urban), (Cruises, Urban), (Destinations, Urban), (Events, Urban), (Marketing, Urban), (Restaurants, Urban)}.
